job_title: Community Support Specialist in Independence, MO
pros: Frequent raises and good benefits. You get to make your own schedule and have your own computer.
cons: Being a community support specialist was sometimes very stressful and time consuming.

job_title: Community Support Specialist in Independence, MO
pros: Flexible schedule while working on education.
cons: Everything else that goes on there

job_title: Housing Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Pay is good combined with new company
cons: Low staffing high turnover for case management

job_title: Case Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: The clients kept me there
cons: Not a good place to work as the CEO does not run the company properly and the board is picked by her

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Independence, MO
pros: Great team, wonderful experience with directors
cons: Pay was not competitive, large caseloads

job_title: Community Support Specialist-Adult in Independence, MO
pros:
Great supervisors
Open to change
Adult's department had a good community feel
Helping people during hard times
cons:
Not much room for advancement
Frequent turnover
Heavy caseloads

pros: Meeting wonderful people from every department. Now all of those people have all since been fired, restrictions placed on them ,or were smart and just walked out. Nice location though.
cons: EVERYTHING ELSE.  It is not being run by the actual ceo. The ceo lets the person below her instill fear into the department heads even ones that don't report to her.  The clients are nice but they are being screwed around because of the high therapist turnover. I have seen therapist come, stay less than a week, then leave. You can't have great therapy sessions if you are always having to start over. Management sucks, one in upper managent should speak up but doesn't, and they DO NOT GIVE RAISES. Even when you take on more job duties. And everything is based on production which is crap. They don't care about employees. If you want to make your life miserable please work at this place and your wish will be granted.

review_title: No value for improving mental health.
pros:
1. Experience with community mental health
2. Flexible schedule except the main office
3. Doing good for those who need it most
4. Co-workers easy to work with
cons:
1. Low pay 
2. Little to no ongoing mental health training opportunities/education
3. Executive team does not care about improving mental health of clients, just meeting the minimum requirements for reimbursement
4. No value in employees so high turnover rate
5. Micromanagement from the executive office trickling down to all roles in the company
6. Vindictive behavior to block future employment opportunities 
7. Backstabbing in management to get ahead
8. No value for quality work just quantity
9.  Upper management is like a mean girls clique... They make fun of lower level employees and only promote their friends
10. Unethical advancement and hiring/firing practices (favoritism)

review_title: Poor business practices, agency treats staff poorly and no investment in keeping people. The upper management is a joke.
pros: The clients are great, good trainers,  but mgt.is so controlling they can't even do their jobs.  Great front line staff that gas a big heart for the clts.
cons: Pay is awful, overtime unpaid, upper mgt. is ridiculous and has no idea how to run a successful company.  This place will not make it long with the rate of turn over, and Medicaid fraud going on. A poor example of how ppl with mental illness should be treated. Job descriptions are not accurate and will change when hired! Would not recommend to my worst enemy.

pros:
Office with a window 
A handful of really great staff who deserve better employers
Can basically set own hours but ...
cons: ... You have to work yourself to death to make productivity. You only get paid if your clients show up. Well, usually only 50 percent (or less) show up. So you end up making no money. You're there 40hrs a week, but only get paid for 20. The leadership is too incompetent to address the client no-show rate. As a result, therapists quit at an alarming rate. I worked there for a year and there was 80% turnover on our staff. Clients have had two, three and sometimes four therapists in ONE YEAR. That is complete negligence. This could easily be fixed if therapists were paid hourly. But leadership won't do anything about it.

pros: Great experience in the mental health field, supervisors promote self care, flexible hours as a CSS, recognize work accomplished. I worked here for 6 years. I loved my clients, loved my team, and it was a bittersweet moment to hand in my 2 weeks notice.
cons: Low pay, compensating for gas mileage is not great

review_title: Mental Health Agency that does not care about its employees
pros: Great training ground to get experience in order to move on to bigger and better.
cons: Low pay, unethical billing practices, and high turnover.

review_title: Everything a Mental Health Agency Shouldn't Be
pros:
Working with clients
Experience to be gained in mental health
Working with other departments and other agencies
cons:
Stressful, the ever present threat  of making "billing", humongous turn-over.
My department had 80 to 100 % turnover, or more the year that I was there !
Do not be fooled: Even though they call themselves a non profit agency, this company is all about making PROFITS for management and Board of Directors.
Lack of concern for their employees.

job_title: Client Service Administrator in Cape Canaveral, FL
pros: Strong lower management that tries their hardest
cons: Upper management is clearly disconnected with what is going on at the lower levels.

pros: I can't think of many except that I did enjoy the peers I worked with that were trying to do their job as was I.
cons: Crappy workplace. Expectations of job can never be met without the sacrifice of the clients served which the company is well aware of but chooses to ignore. It is a revolving door of employees in this department. Most stay less than one year.

review_title: Looking for a hidden gem in Independence, MO? You found it!
pros: Friendly professional coworkers, schedule flexibility, good benefits, great working conditions, nice and clean facility, paid holidays, easy commute to locations.
cons: Comprehensive is not paperless and could use EMR.  Would also like to see tuition reimbursement available to employees in the future.

pros: Gain good experience with mental health population.  Relationships between peers can be ongoing and rewarding long after leaving the company.
cons: Terrible treatment of employees,  unethical and immoral practices, feels like a dictatorship as administration are control addicts and overbearing. Will do anything to bill down allocation despite ethical, or not.  Low morale throughout entire agency and unfair hiring and promotion practices. Allegations of unequal race practices and divide.

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Kansas City, MO
pros: They really value teamwork and individual self-care. You can tell that your supervisors care and they take to heart whatever criticisms come their way.  Medical benefits are pretty good.
cons: The paid time off scales poorly. Your first year you get very few days off.

pros:
Good pay
Flexible hours
reasonable work load
cons:
horrible management
catty behaviors in upper mgmt
unethical practices
benefits average
mgmt targets employees they don't "like"
vision of company has been lost

review_title: If you want to be treated terrible, work here.
pros: The people you meet that actually do the work.  The 'line ' workers are great people that help the less fortunate every day.
cons: The administrator's do not have a clue about staff retention nor do they seem to care. The fear of going against management is always in the air.

review_title: It’s a fast pace environment that can be high stress at times, but overall it’s a very rewarding job.

pros: The pay is really great.
cons: There is not a con that I can think of.

pros: Lots of autonomy, good supportive community
